simulated_ratings.title: George Carlin: You Are All Diseased (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Carlin’s sharp bite hits more than it misses and I laughed plenty.

simulated_ratings.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark) (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pure adventure comfort—thrilling, funny, and endlessly rewatchable.

simulated_ratings.title: To Die For (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly funny and slick, if a bit chilly for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex * But Were Afraid to Ask (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy, uneven sketches with enough clever bits to keep me smiling.

simulated_ratings.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Charming, witty, and warm—an easy, feel-good watch.

simulated_ratings.title: English Patient, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous and sweeping, a touch slow, but the romance lands.

simulated_ratings.title: Manhattan Murder Mystery (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, clever mystery vibes with playful humor I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Chasing Coral (2017)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Silly fun—more chuckles than belly laughs, but enjoyable.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic bits that still land

simulated_ratings.feeling: Toe-tapping, playful, and picturesque—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Small Time Crooks (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: The Secret Life of Pets (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bright, bouncy pet antics—simple fun that works for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Raising Arizona (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Zany and heartfelt in that offbeat Coen way—very enjoyable.

simulated_ratings.title: Purple Rose of Cairo, The (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet, wistful movie-magic fable that hits my soft spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Victor/Victoria (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sparkling tunes and playful gender-bending comedy—delightful.

simulated_ratings.title: Bull Durham (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, witty, and romantic with great chemistry.

simulated_ratings.title: Nobody's Fool (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Low-key, lived-in drama with humor and heart.

simulated_ratings.title: Amadeus (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand, entertaining, and musical—catnip for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Dark Star: HR Giger’s World (2014)

simulated_ratings.title: Life of Pi (2012)

simulated_ratings.title: Remains of the Day, The (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, restrained heartbreak that quietly lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Broadcast News (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, funny, and humane with sharp career-and-romance sparks.

simulated_ratings.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A joyous, witty romp with perfect father-son adventure.

simulated_ratings.title: What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some intriguing ideas, but the new-agey, uneven package wears thin for me.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Pitch-black and mean-spirited—some tension, but not my kind of laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Little Shop of Horrors (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Catchy, delightfully macabre musical fun that hits my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Visually striking and bold, but too cruel and chilly for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Tom & Viv (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Well-acted and somber

simulated_ratings.title: The Last Desperate Hours (1974)

simulated_ratings.title: Beck 16 - The Last Witness (2002)

simulated_ratings.title: Hard Day's Night, A (1964)

simulated_ratings.title: White Christmas (1954)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, melodic holiday comfort—old-fashioned in the best way.

simulated_ratings.title: Dead Slow Ahead (2016)

simulated_ratings.title: Ne skazhu (2010)

simulated_ratings.title: Work of Director Michel Gondry, The (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: A Star Is Born (2018)

simulated_ratings.title: In the Mouth of Madness (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Creepy, clever meta-horror—effective, if not quite my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: A Monster Calls (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Beautiful, cathartic fable blending wonder and grief gracefully.

simulated_ratings.title: Remember Me (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet and earnest later-life romance that is touching if a bit contrived.

simulated_ratings.title: Holmes and Watson (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Silly, scattershot mystery spoof with a few chuckles but mostly misses for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: The Last Jedi (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spectacle, heart, and wit—space-opera adventure that kept me engaged and smiling.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy, fast-paced wrap-up with enough thrills and sentiment to entertain me.

simulated_ratings.title: Legend of 1900, The (a.k.a. The Legend of the Pianist on the Ocean) (Leggenda del pianista sull'oceano) (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: Backdraft 2 (2019)

simulated_ratings.title: His Way (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Polished, breezy Hollywood reminiscence that’s engaging and informative.

simulated_ratings.title: Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust (Banpaia hantâ D) (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: Agathe Cléry (2008)
